Reviews.Title: “Best located if you are visiting the ancient sites”
Reviews.Author: RenatoFuzz
Reviews.Content: Good bedrooms and breakfast. Very good bathtub and shower. Dispite of being at 150 from the train station it is not noisy. Most lower apartments have a good bathtub if you like. Leave the hotel, turn left and walk straight for 2 blocks. Tratoria famiglia offers good and cheap food if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Central and good”
Reviews.Author: chocolat61
Reviews.Content: Very close to the Termini train station this hotel is a perfect starting point for your Rome adventures. The breakfast buffet was very good and replenished amply. Only downside (previously mentioned by guests) is the shower in the rooms that create flooding, but that's nothing. Free WIFI in the room, friendly staff, a nice deco. What are we asking for more? Prices were - for Rome - absolutely ok:-)

Reviews.Title: “Good location to train station”
Reviews.Author: LeanneM2012
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at Hotel Royal Santina and were not especially impressed by the hotel although it seemed fairly recently refurbished it would be better suited to business travelers as it lacked atmosphere and quite sterile. Our room was a decent size (i think we may have been given and upgrade), clean, although the air-conditioning had us baffled and the shower leaked excessively. We were not impressed that coffee / cappuccino during breakfast was out of an automatic machine, given we are in Italy a four star hotel I believed it should have been made by staff. Hotel was about 15min cab ride from good restaurants, those recommended locally were below average and disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: mel0diz
Reviews.Content: Air conditioning in hotel was not working. When contacted, the staff simply came up, meddled with the air conditioning control and walked away, leaving us puzzled and with the air conditioning still not working. Shower area was not well thought of when designed and built. After every shower, the whole bathroom will be flooded.

Reviews.Title: “chic and neat hotel”
Reviews.Author: kiki1229
Reviews.Content: rooms are unexpectedly neat and clean, overall atmosphere is good, quiet environment, near to Termini station,

Reviews.Title: “I do not stay anymore!”
Reviews.Author: santahunter
Reviews.Content: I came the hotel from Frenze with 6 suite cases, 2 women and 7 month baby. We arrived the hotel at 2:00, the hotel did not prepare the room. I got the key around 2:40 but the room had not cleaned yet so I waited for 10 min with 7 month baby. also I realized the hotel offers bathtub and baby bed and some stuff for baby so I contacted front desk to ask they seldom did not answer the phone and told me that ask room service but room service told me that ask front desk anyway the hotel does not have bathtub and baby stuff what I asked. Finally they brought baby bed but it was broken. I ordered room service but they did not bring anti pasta so I called room service. they said the menu is comming then hang up but the menu is not comming because of out of ingredient. and I order gelato but they brought ice cream. every hospitality sucks!!! I belived Best western brand but I disapointed so much I never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “odd place”
Reviews.Author: janye
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 weeks in Italy, October 2011, the last week was a 7 day RCL cruise in and out of Civitecchia. The Royal Santina was our RCL post cruise hotel. We should have made our own arrangements at a hotel near the airport. as this hotel is no where near the airport but is very near the main Roma train Termini. We past the airport in the RCL shuttle and drove all the way back into Rome. It cost quite a bit the next morning to taxi back out to the airport early in the morning. Decor was garish neon and staff was abrupt. Nice bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: sped123311
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights prior to a cruise departing from Civitavecchia. The hotel was very close to Termini Station. We arrived at FCO, hopped on a train and were at the hotel in a short time. The hotel was clean, modern, and included a free breakfast. The location was great and provided lots of travel options to see the sites in Rome. After we finished our stay, we returned to Termini and took a train to Civitavecchia. It was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient to Rome's Transportation System”
Reviews.Author: calflyer80
Reviews.Content: I found the property to be most adequite. The room was clean, comfortable, quite, and pleasantly differant. The contemporary styling with mood lights was a refreshing change from the typical drab hotel room. The staff was friendly but not over bearing. The breakfast buffet was good and certainly pleantiful. Because of the lack of consistancy of the Best Western brand I was somewhat reluctant to select Hotel Royal Santina. However, I was very satisfied with my selection and would stay here again. A pleasant surprise is the Airport Express Bus terminus is right outside the front door. I arrived from the airport on the Leonardo Express.train. Although the train station is across from the hotel it was not convenient to the airport train located at a remote area of the station. Otherwise, the hotel is very convenient to inter-city trains, the local bus center, Metro, and tour busses.

Reviews.Title: “Don't visit unless you get a room where the heating works properly”
Reviews.Author: Peter D
Reviews.Content: We stayed in two rooms. One was a shocker. You could not turn the heat down to below 25C. On the second complaint, I was told it was a known problem for the rooms at the front of the hotel. Our children stayed at the back, and their room was perfect. Such a pity as the rooms layouts and ceanliness are great, the service good, and breakfasts and location perfect.

Reviews.Title: “one word........perfect”
Reviews.Author: alexhaimo
Reviews.Content: Service=Excellent Value=Excellent Sleep Quality=Excellent Cleanliness=Excellent Location=Excellent Rooms=Excellent the stuff=Excellent

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern!”
Reviews.Author: mdcwilson
Reviews.Content: This place came recommended to us by an Italian friend . She stays here when she visits Rome. Location is across from the Roma termini. But to get to the main attractions you have to walk (which we did) or grab a taxi. Rooms are ultra modern and our son loved the mood lighting. Extremely clean and roomier than most Italian hotel rooms. Breakfast is good but don't bother with the coffee (out of a machine). Suggestions?? The front staff could take some tips on smiling. They did a good job but not once did anyone smile while they were waiting on people.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for the service offered”
Reviews.Author: Olivier B
Reviews.Content: Washbasin and shower clog up. It took two days to solve the problem. Modern design of the room but no privacy, at least for the toilettes which are separated from the room by a simple sliding glass wall. Breakfast buffet is plentiful but "espresso" and "cappuccino" are from a press button machine with the quality you can expect from such a machine (This hotel is in Rome, the capital of the country of the expresso and cappuccino!). If you complain, the waiter try to convince you that you are wrong and that the cappuccino is actually "delicious". The fruit juice is a strange chemical solution...The service offered is definitively not corresponding to what you can expect from a 4 stars hotel and the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice!”
Reviews.Author: Jetset707
Reviews.Content: First off the hotel is extremely well located - across from Termini. Easy access to the airport, subway, long distance trains, cabs, organized tours and the hop on hop off buses. Completely safe area.The hotel was totally renovated quite recently. Very modern style rooms including mood lighting. The rooms are well soundproofed. Everything inside the room is new & worked perfectly (a/c, lights, etc) - great bathroom. The staff was helpful and cheerful. Morning breakfast was included and well worth it with a wide variety of items to choose from. Would stay here again without hesitation. TIPS: (a) The restaurants nearby are very touristy and not great options. If you walk left out of the hotel, turn left at one of the next two blocks and walk down a block or two for a decent pizzeria (quick bite - take out or they have a few tables). Can't recall the name or street but it was a corner location if that helps. (b) If using a hop on hop off (recommended), Roma Cristiana has the most frequent buses and is the way to go . Look for their yellow coaches at the stop across from Termini at the Piazza Republica.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, quiet room, walk to train”
Reviews.Author: jimmythec1
Reviews.Content: Hotel is modern with colored lights in the rooms. Bed was nice, bathroom large by european standards. Our room overlooked the quiet "smoking" courtyard, but there was nobody there so it was especially peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “well, you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: OUILEY
Reviews.Content: we arrived and our room wasn't ready so we went on a guided tour. after several hours, we returned and go into our room. we found it rather spacious for a european hotel. the bed frame was such that i stubbed my toe on it 3 times in 4 hours. the balcony was nice, but it was noisy outside all the time. the room is such that your roomcard has to be inserted in order to turn on the air, heat and lights. the bathroom was also spacious, but the shower door was only 1/2 the width of the tub and flooded the floor. i asked for assistance in a night tour and the desk people were not helpful at all. upon arriving where they said the bus was, there was no bus. upon searching, i found it 2 blocks away. overall, the location was great, near the train station (which i didn't use) but the cost was extraordinary (over 300 euros per night).

Reviews.Title: “exelent”
Reviews.Author: anna z
Reviews.Content: I do not know how this hotel can not be happy! He stylish, next to the subway, with excellent breakfast and dinner, rooms are large, comfortable beds, a few steps from wonderful shopping streets of Via Nazionale, next to the famous pastry shop ... Well, what else does a man to be happy? The curtain in the bathroom? So wash gently, or use the shower (where, incidentally, is a function of rain). In-room safe. They even give a hair straightener! Where do you see more than a shampoo and shower gel and even body lotion? And the full-length mirror. By the way, continental breakfast includes a drink, toast, butter and jam. And all that extra - it's a generous soul hotel management! And then just a feast: ham, sausage, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, cheese, fresh rolls, cakes, croissants (empty, with chocolate cream), fresh fruit (I got on the kiwi, pineapple and melon). In general, I do not understand some of the resentment that a tourist hotel! I lived in a hotel during a tour round the cities of Italy. You should have seen what could be 4 stars! Yes, this hotel is just gorgeous! 5 stars, no less! Moreover, I would say that my first few days of the tour was not disgusting to touch anything in the room! In general, if I still be going to Rome (and I'm going!), I will only live in this hotel! Thank you for your attention.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Helsinki1972
Reviews.Content: We visited Best Western Santina 2 nights (pre and post cruise) in August 2011. We paid 98 Euros per night, including breakfast. Location: The hotel is located next to the main railways station of Rome. In case you are going to the cruise port (Civitavecchia) or airport, the location of the hotel could not be any better! Please note that the airport busses both to/from Fiuminico and Campiano arrive right in front of the door of the hotel (being roughly half price of the express train to Fiuminico and taking about 1hr and 10 minutes). You can’t have it more convenient. The trains to Civitavecchia and Fiuminico leave from Termini, right next to the hotel. Please be aware that mentioned trains leave from the “far” train track. Walking with all your luggage, we could make it in 20 minutes. But I would suggest to calculate at least a 30 minute walk if you in average/good condition and have luggage. For sightseeing, you may want to consider taking the metro from Termini. We took the metro from Termini to St. Peter and walked our way back to the hotel from there. Reception: Friendly, helpful and spoke English well. Room: We were here for 2 nights before and after the cruise. The first night we got room 111, which was a large room, very clean. We were very pleasantly surprised. It has a mood light, you can adjust yourself. Comfortable bed and pillos. The 2nd night, we received a room on the 4th floor, which was really small. As we were on a continuing trip, we had 2 large suitcases with us you really have to figure out how to store these in the room. The only possibility is having them on the ground, which decreases the already limited walking space. We booked the same room category for the same price, but wound up with totally different rooms. You may want to communicate with the hotel beforehand in order to secure a larger room. Breakfast: Was very good. Note that almost half of the buffet consists out of cakes and sweet pies (which I personally like). All was clean and fresh. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, especially if you have a pre/post airport/cruise port arrival/departure, due to its excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean hotel convenient to Termini”
Reviews.Author: Tony C
Reviews.Content: This is a conveniently located hotel, right across the street from Termini Train Station. Of course, the Leonardo Express train from the airport drops you off at the very furthest point of the train station so you will still have a long walk through the crowded station before you get to the street in front of the hotel. The airport express bus is across the street from the hotel, as is the taxi stable. I would still recommend you contact the hotel about getting a limo to/from the airport. As far as the hotel, nothing special. It is busy, the Royal Caribbean Cruise Lines had a check in desk during our stay. It is more "American" than is standard fare in Europe. We stayed here since my wife was a new International traveler so I did not want to be surprised by a classic European hotel, and it was just what I expected. Overall, it is a good hotel, for a fair price considering the location. Nothing special. The breakfast buffet has a good variety of breads, pastries and hot items like meat and eggs. I would recommend this hotel for any traveler looking for a convenient location and with no surprises. We did find a better hotel near there that we will use in the future. I would recommend this

Reviews.Title: “Sporadic air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: grapplegrommett
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well situated across the road from the Roma Termini Train Station. It has immediate access to all tour buses. Service at the hotel is very good. The rooms are spacious by european standards. One small annoyance was the air conditioning is turned off in the middle of each night to all the rooms. We could never get a clear answer as to why this was and each night we had to call down in the middle of the night and request that the air conditioning be turned back on in our room. An annoyance but not impossible to overcome. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Funky mood lighting...otherwise generic”
Reviews.Author: buytherules
Reviews.Content: I picked the hotel because of location close to train station (a 5 minute walk) and knew it had been recently renovated (Spring 2010). The room was modern and would have been considered spacious for 2, but we were 3 people in a triple room, so found the room tight - not enough space to put down our 3 suitcases. Although just renovated, it was easy to see that they were cheaply done and the hotel will likely be in bad shape quickly - it seemed like everything was made of plastic. The multi-colored mood lighting was fun to play with, but all of the walls in the washroom were frosted glass, making turning on the lights for a late night visit feel as though a spot light had been turned on. The shower was powerful, but did not drain quickly enough resulting in daily flooding that reached into the room. On the plus side, the beds were quite comfortable, the rooms were quiet, the WiFi was strong with free access in the lobby and the entire hotel was very clean. Service was friendly, efficient and available 24 hours. The breakfast buffet had plenty of options, but was rather generic - as expected with this type of hotel. The coffee from the machine was pretty lousy. The area surrounding the hotel is standard for big cities – would not recommend walking alone late at night, but otherwise safe enough. Overall, the hotel is good if all you need is a clean bed with proximity to the train station, beyond that – there are more interesting places in Rome to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Well sized rooms, location is directly across the road from the Station and approx 20 min walk to Trevi Fountain.”
Reviews.Author: Anon7643
Reviews.Content: Rooms are spacious and modern and the bathrooms include a lovely large bath tub! Rooms are exactly as they appear on the website. The mood control lighting is fun, however be prepared for some confusion with all of the light switches. Location of this hotel is fantastic- not quite in the heart of Rome, and just across the road from Termini Station. The metro within Rome is very simple (only 2 lines which take you to most of the Tourist sights. All day tickets cost $4.00 euros) This hotel is approx 20min walk to the Trevi Fountain! Hotel reception are friendly and speak basic English. Our only complaint would be the state of the bathroom upon checkin. It looked as though it had only half been cleaned and there appeared to be no light above the shower (quite hard to shower in the dark) we spoke to Reception about this on our way out for dinner and were advised that they would have a look. Upon returning late from dinner we checked on the status with Reception who had forgotten to follow it up. Since it was so late we said that we would speak with the reception staff in the morning. We spoke with the reception staff in the morning and we were assured that they would chase up our query. Again no update provided so we admitted defeat and continued to shower in the dimly lit bathroom. Our room price included buffet breakfast- there was a large assortment of cakes, pastries etc. If you are used to something a bit heavier they also had scrambled eggs, boiled eggs and bacon. We paid $305au p/night which I feel was too expensive for the service provided. Fortunately we were able to use Best Western travel cards which were redeemed using Qff points!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: kdinon
Reviews.Content: Right opposite Rome Termini Station, all the convenience without the noise. Fabulous breakfast, great staff who went out of their way to accommodate us with bike storage. Booked a weekend deal where you pay for 2 nights and get a 3rd night free, great deal!! Would highly recommend it and will stay next time in Rome. Great 4 star hotel at a 3 star price. Also you get to choose your own pillow from the menu, great for people with neck problems. Only problem was not great wifi in the room, but a computer in the foyer for Internet access which was free.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carol52
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights before a cruise. Very clean modern hotel with helpful staff. Across the road from Termini Station and beside the stop for the airport shuttle. Good sound proofing and a good buffet breakfast. Would gtay here again

Reviews.Title: “It's a nice hotel but not a 4*”
Reviews.Author: bbetoo
Reviews.Content: Clean and nice but not a 4* hotel in my opinion. Price a little bit high. Breakfast was good and staff very nice. Location is good. I got annoyed with the fact they gave me 2 beds instead of the big couple bed i requested. The city tax is 3€/night/person!!!! ROBBERY!!!

Reviews.Title: “All roads may lead to Rome, but my stop is here!”
Reviews.Author: JeffYB
Reviews.Content: A pleasant surprise with very reasonable prices, terrific location, a comfortable & spacious room and pretty good breakfast (this is after all, Italy). The staff were always helpful, responsive and really looking out for (and not just after) their guests. Located just beside Termini, it’s always busy both in & outside the hotel. I really liked the place, and within the context of this being Rome, I would seek out and stay again, even if the more famous spots are not just steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient transfer hotel”
Reviews.Author: Simon145
Reviews.Content: Close to Termini station this hotel is convenient if you are traveling, like everywhere around main train stations the area is busy and not picturesque. Rooms are quiet though and modern but small, no exception to many hotels in Rome. Well assorted breakfast buffet. For dinner go elsewhere. Opposite hop-on hop-off bus stop. No rooms were available when we asked at reception, but we could make a reservation on booking.com in the lobby on our smartphone. Within seconds the reservation was known and we could check in. A certain amount of rooms are reserved for for tour operators and booking sites (allotment).

Reviews.Title: “excellent base in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Stubbies35
Reviews.Content: had the pleasure of staying here while in Rome. Stayed for 3 nights. Breakfast was fantastic more than adequate. About a 1 min walk with luggage from the Roma termini. Rooms very clean and spacious. Another great feature was free internet use, excellent Could'nt ask for a better base, will go back here again no problem. Thanks for a great stay Best Western see you next time

Reviews.Title: “Average experience”
Reviews.Author: roxythestar
Reviews.Content: Stayed several nights here. Had a good experience, everything went fairly smooth. No use in asking for restaurant recommendations as they give out standard recommendations that aren't that good. Directions for transportation was a bit off as well. In the morning they started very early cleaning so it was a bit noisy. On the pro side the hotel was very clean and very modern. Could stay again but not sure.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly, convenient to train station and many restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: Judy0549
Reviews.Content: Our first night in Italy, tired and frazzled, this hotel was a haven. From reception to breakfast an A+ experience.

Reviews.Title: “RUDE STAFF, BAD SERVICE, AMERICAN TRAVELERS BEWARE!!”
Reviews.Author: LakeSaintLouisMom
Reviews.Content: Imagine traveling from the US on a 15 hour flight and being told you had to wait 4 hours to check in! While you sit and wait you watch people off the street check in. If you want to feel like a 2nd class citizen then this is the hotel for you! We have never in our lives been treated like this at any hotel. Granted this is a best western so its not a real 4 star hotel by American standards but the service even for a best western from the check in staff was a nightmare and was the worse part of our two week vacation. We booked this hotel as a package with our cruise line. We had two options this more expensive hotel and a lower star cheaper hotel. Of course after paying 12k already for this trip, flight, cruise, and tours we wanted this more expensive hotel for our special vacation. What a joke! The service and treatment you get for this hotel is not worth it. It was so bad we tried to change our 2nd stay at this hotel with our cruise line but couldn't as it was to late. Yes we had to indure the rude check in staff twice! Had to sit in the lobby and watch people check in before us twice! We stayed April 17th and April 29th. My husband asked the first time we checked in why others where being checked in and not us (and the other tourists mostly American from the cruise line) while Italians came in and checked in no issues. This rude RUDE lady named Paola at the front desk told my husband that it was the contract with the cruise line. NO check in till 2PM. First off no one sees this contract till you get to the hotel. They give you the contract then from a rep from the cruise line in the lobby. When he argued with the desk lady Paola saying how he saw others checking in she responded with they had more expensive rooms! Surely this woman was joking as all the rooms are either singles, double, or triple. We had a double (two twins pushed together to make one double size bed) with breakfast and a photographic view room being the 2nd most expensive per night room they have! Not everyone checking in before us Americans where triple bed rooms! My husband called her out and told her she was lying to his face as rooms where obviously open but we where forced to wait after our 15 hour flight. She didn't care no room for us.She didn't care we knew she was lying. She didn't care that rooms where actually open. Finaly as we threatened the cruise line rep stating that we wanted to leave and find a better hotel the cruise rep called her boss to call the hotel and talk to the rude hotel staff. So at 1230 over two hours of waiting we got a room. I don't know of anyone that has ever gone to a hotel and had to endure crazy strict check in times if rooms are open! No hotel does that! I have worked at a hotel before and if a room is open or dirty you call to get it cleaned and get people checked in. Especialy tourists. Well not this place! And dont expect to check out with the other guests at the hotel at 12 PM. If you go with a cruiseline check out is at 10AM! This is per Paola who works the check in desk in the mornings. She doesnt check if you ask to check out like the other people at 12 but just says NO. She must have special powers that allow her to know those things without looking at the computer to see. Just knows how to be rude and say NO and argue with guests. We waited till she left and talked to the nicer men working at night. The night manager looked stunned that we where asking to check out at 12. He kept saying this is normal check out you don't need anything special to check out with everyone else. They let us check out with everyone else at 12. All the information in the hotel, in your room, everything says check out is at 12. Paola of course was sticking to a contract that didnt even match our paperwork from the cruise that had it at even a different time. In her world we where tourist 2nd class citizens that needed to be out of her hotel at 10AM. Wouldnt it make sense to treat everyone the same? EQUAL! Not this place. They seem to have it backwards and treat the tourists like dogs. I have never in my life been treated this way at a hotel with such rudeness from the check in staff. We figured the room cost us atleast 300 if not more with breakfast a night in US Dollars. And this is the sevice we got both times at check in for our money. We spoke to the other cruise group on the bus to the ship about the cheaper hotel they stayed at and no one at the cheaper hotel was treated like that or forced to wait hours to get a room. So basicly I paid more to be treated worse at this hotel. Breakfast if your from the US is not what you would think. Its GROSS. The bacon is like some soggy strange bacon that was not eatable. The eggs not good and the Orange Juice and Milk where bad. We ate the pastrys. Only thing you would want to eat after tasting the other stuff. That was it for breakfast as that was the only non cheaply made bad tasting food. This hotel is located in an area close to everything. You can grab a taxi at Termini station right across the street and take a 12 euro ride to the tourist spots you want to see. That was the only plus at this place. Typical small european rooms. Walls in rooms have scuff marks on them all over. Oh and if you go when its colder like we did no heat! They turn the heat off for spring at this hotel so expect cold mornings. You can turn the AC on in your room but can't make it warmer at night or in the morning. Not a 4 star hotel by American standards. I did leave a comment card and did tell the night manager of the check in rudeness with the staff and issues. So this hotel was left writen comments from us about this. I would suggest from how I saw Americans treated that best for US travelers to stay at a real four or five star by US standard hotels. You might pay more but you wont be left in the lobby waiting all day to get a room, rushed out like your scum in the morning per the attitude of the check in staff, and wont be treated over all like 2nd class. We wont be staying here next spring when we go back. You don't need us Americans at your hotel then you don't need our money! If we are such a bother to you when we go to ask questions at the front desk or check in then don't worry we wont be seeing you next spring!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location to termini station”
Reviews.Author: valuetrav
Reviews.Content: The Royal Santini was a great place to stay.The room was a perfect size for me and the mrs.modern and stylish decor,helpful staff and breakfast was spot on. it's an ideal location near the termini and although its earmarked as a little unsafe my group and i had no issues over the weekend.its best to have your wits about you at any case in all parts of the city so use common sense and all will be fine.we don't mind walking so getting to the various sites of interest from the hotel was no trouble for us.taxis are cheap so use them as an alternative and public transport is fine also.I would recommend getting a tour of the vatican over any other landmark.we were lucky and just made it on this particular tour(3.30ish) and had the vatican halls almost to ourselves so we ended up getting a very informative and fulfilling afternoon.You get to skip the line if you sign to a tour also and finally there is no point doing this in the morning as you won't get any satisfaction with the masses of people behind you.The area of the trevi fountain is a complete rip off for food and drink.avoid drinking imported beers anywhere as its a license for these bars to charge extortionary prices.i wouldn't recommend eating food after 9pm in certain areas as restaurants tend to morph into cocktail bars/nightclubs so standards slip.our holiday was firstly a disaster but ended up being a great break and i'll explain why.i recommend travel only with hand luggage as the bag handlers went on strike.this effected one of the people in my group.secondly the taxi drivers are a little pushy in front of the train escalators trying to look for business.we got a taxi when heading for home and paid 50euro(4 people) from the hotel so pay no more than that.our intention was always to get the train however so went down the escalotor after receiving a bit of abuse from the taxi rep.be careful when you buy train tickets at the counter.thankfully we had a receipt but the guy sold us out of date tickets so when the inspector came around there was a bit of explaining to do.we were absoulutely disgusted and the inspector said he would investigate this further.in honesty though i believe they are all in this scam.i'd hate to think what would happen if we didn't have the receipt.A bad start to our break but this was soon overshadowed by the hotel and beauty this city has to offer

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: tamacnab
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here last week for five nights. It is in a very convenient location from the Termini Station. It is probably about a 3-4 minute walk from the Termini. We reserved a non-smoking room in advance and were pleased with the cleanliness and size of the room. It also had a nice fridge that was stocked with sodas, water, etc. The bed was also extremely comfortable. Hot water was always available in the shower. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I had an early morning flight (train not running this early) so they booked a driver for me at a reasonable rate (50 Euro). The breakfast buffet was great. Good selection of pastries and jams. Also had scrambled eggs and some meats. We were very pleased with it. It was probably busiest from 0730-0900. There were a few downsides though. On two occassions secondhand smoke filtered into our room via the ventilation. As non-smokers this was very irritating. Luckily it was not for an extended period of time. Additionally, due to the time of year we were unable to turn on the AC so it did get a little warm in the room a few times. The showerhead also took a little adjusting to. You had to weight it down with something or else it would spray everywhere. Last comment is that it was probably a little overpriced. We paid about $200US per night (166 Euro). It probably should have been in the $175US range. Overall, it was a great experience and we would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “I expected more...”
Reviews.Author: OdohVideh
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a double room, and it was too small for a 4 star hotel. I was told at the reception that all the rooms are that small. On the foolr plan some seemed bigger but those were twin bedrooms. Though it was clean and the bed was comfortable. The towels were changed every day. I didn't like the glass slide bathroom door that didn't close properly. The heating was good. The window was locked. The lobby and the dining area design is a bit cold. The location is very good. We didn't feel unsafe staying near the Termini station. Our room faced another building - no room view, but also no traffic, no noise, so we could sleep. :) We were on the 4th floor and we could use the WIFI in our room without any problems (the signal was good and it was unlimitted). At the reception they were polite and more or less they could speak English. The day of our departure they even served the breakfast at 6:15 so that we wouldn't miss our morning flight. In general, the breakfast quality was average.

Reviews.Title: “good location great rooms super modern and clean”
Reviews.Author: travelabound
Reviews.Content: i booked and prepaid the hotel for a business room which was 97.50 euro a night. i have arrived on 7th feb in the evening from fumicino. the hotel is next to termini station so its very convenient to/from airport. the airport shuttle stops upfront .check in was easy , and i was assigned room 711. i loved the room the moment i walked in !! very modern , everything lights, sink etc very contemporary. very good light on the bed side for reading in bed before turning in.room rate includes free minibar which is nice. there is a plasma tv, and the room is spacious and very quite !!there was a large screen computer in the lobby which was free and i have used it few times. i speak italian so i found the staff pretty helpful and nice. my only gripe is the breakfast which is included , it could be better especially cheese selection !!! only one type and this in a country that has great cheeses 2-3 types would make a big difference. to sum it , i loved the hotel enjoyed my stay , and would recommend it wholeheartedly !!!!! if you like modern building, contemporary spacious clean room this is it. the rate was pretty good too so i was very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE HOTEL RECENTLY RENOVATED IN VERY MODERN STYLE.”
Reviews.Author: FINOLA05 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Five of us visited this hotel for the italy v ireland rugby match and spent 4 nights. The decor is very modern throughout - and tastefully done. The rooms were very comfortable and a decent size. Our bathrooms were "wet rooms" and a good size. Located near termini station the soundproofing was excellent. The only down side to this location is that there tends to be a number of street-dwellers - however they were not intrusive. Being near the station, all parts of the city are within easy reach. The staff were most helpful and accommodating and go out of their way to assist when required. There was a great camaraderie amongst the staff which i think indicates a happy ship!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, Great location, clean rooms, Great for families!”
Reviews.Author: CalItal
Reviews.Content: We stayed in three hotels over two weeks in Rome, with our three children. This hotel was voted the best by all in our party. We paid a bit more, since there are five of us and had the adjoining two room family package. We are frequent Best Western hotel stayers so, we are used to their usual ammenities. We had to show up about three hours before regular checkin, they were able to give us one of our rooms right away. The room included a video game package which they promptly set up for us. The rooms were really great. They were large for Rome standards. They adjoined by a hallway, which we could close off from the main hallway. One room had a large king bed, the other a king bed with a good sized sofa/couch (not a foldout). Both rooms had minifridges, with items you could purchase if you wanted-they check it daily if you like this option. The bathrooms were very clean and modern. The larger room's bathroom had a tub and a glassed shower. Both rooms had in room safes in the closets, good space in both closets as well. The kids loved the neon color lights which you can change to fit your mood, four choices. At night you can look out to the center patio of the hotel and see all the colored squares it is really great! The location at the termini is fabulous, you can get to the trains, subway or buses in minutes! There is several great kid friendly restaurants in front of and inside the termini, and a grocery store as well. We bought a lot of snacks for the kids there to keep in our room, they have a hot food counter as well. The noises of this area did not bother us in the slightest. There is a terminal in front of the hotel for the SIT buses, which run to both airports, so no need for a taxi or to fight to figure train schedule, January 2011, it was 8 euro per person. It does take about 45 minutes to get to fumicino from the hotel. The breakfast which was included in our rate was great!. The staff of three replenished it frequently, Items included: scrambled/hardboiled eggs, yogurts, broiche and other sweet rolls, toasts, jams, honey, juices, on demand coffee machine with hot chocolate, warm milk and 4-5 coffee choices, 4 cereal choices with fresh milk, bacon, and a meat and cheese tray. They even have a little corner for kids, with high chairs, nesquik to mix chocolate milk, crayons, and a large tub of nutella. They have a computer for guest use in the lobby. The elevators/lifts are large and work well. The rooms are made up every day, a keep very clean. The manager was so patient with us as well as we checked out with some best western reward gift cards we had earned through their reward program. He called the help line and proceed to run them in a efficient and speedy manner. The staff was friendly and helpful all around! We hope to return to this hotel soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Abhisshek
Reviews.Content: Right outside the Termini station, it could not have been located at a better place. A cab ride to Vatican would cost €10-12. The rooms are nice and the breakfast is great, which means you can have a good start to your day. Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Syndicates (thieves.....) Operating in hotel lobby”
Reviews.Author: AdamBotiga
Reviews.Content: This is a warning to other potential bookers based upon the following experience encountered with the hotel as follows:- 1. Due to our family requirements, we had requested via direct phone call to the hotel for two connecting rooms and the hotel confirmed the availability accordingly. 2. Booked directly via Best Western web site upon hotel confirmation for our requested room arrangement. 3. Upon arrival, was informed by a RUDE girl at the front desk that the connecting rooms were not available and that they would try to have this sorted out the following day. We were given two rooms located a couple of doors away from each other (we could not accept this as we needed to attend to our two children. Furthermore, it was extremely inconvenient). We were subsequently given a junior suite (that I saw could only just fit two adults and some luggage, much less a family of four with seven luggages) as a compromise for their mistake. I did not accept this. 4. I refused to accept this unreasonable behavior and demanded to see the manager on duty. However none was available. 5. The rude Italian girl could not even express herself in English, she should not be working at the front desk! Imagine working for an American hospitality chain and struggling with BASIC English language. She even insisted that no phone call to the hotel ever took place and glared at me as if it were my fault. So was the phone call just a dream?! 6. Eventually we were attended to by a very helpful guy (Chua) whom spoke perfect English and was also very professional and apologetic due to the situation at hand, which he mentioned was no fault of theirs but did express that the reservation team could have better handled this matter. 7. While all this was happening, some “guys” took advantage of the situation and walked up to our family members and started to distract them by pretending to ask for directions. 8. Meanwhile, we decided to leave this hotel immediately due to the very bad, poor and unprofessional handling of the situation and REALIZED THAT ONE OF OUR BAGS WAS GONE! In summary, beware of this hotel due to the non-existence of neither security personnel nor security control monitoring system, as well as limited staff to adequately serve guests, and is also very vulnerable to undesirable elements due to its close proximity to the train station that ultimately attracts lots of human traffic outside of the hotel entrance (via Marsala). I testify that this is a true and accurate event, and a police report has been filed for the loss of our belongings, which occured within the hotel's premises.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: Seeingamerica
Reviews.Content: If you want the best rate, book on the internet only. We booked three nights for 270 Euros or 90 Euros per night. When we asked to extend our stay at the same rate, Monica stated that we could. Upon check out, we discovered we had been charged 135 Euros for the extra night. Because we had a flight to catch, we were stuck because there was no manager on duty and Monica was unwilling to make any adjustment even though the web site states 92 Euros for Pay Now and Save and 90.90 Euros for Winter Sale. I put this hotel in the same league as the restaurants that place unordered bread on your table and charge for it. Also our room was not air conditioned as their web site states. Again the front desk said, “Just open a window”. The only problem with that is the street noise. Fortunately, we had ear plugs. On the good side, the hotel has been refurbished and the breakfast includes eggs. I have worked in the travel industry for 40 years and I was dumbfounded by Ms. Grande’s, the manger, email which stated that a rate adjustment would not be made and she was sorry she could not exceed my expectation. She failed miserably to even meet the minimum expectation which is to greet your customer like a guest and treat your guest in a fair and honest manor.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: annebryceland
Reviews.Content: Loved the modern design and lovely, airy public areas. Bedrooms superb.I loved being able to choose the colour of the lighting. Flat screen tv . fridge,good hairdryer, comfortable beds. Free wi fi excellent bonus. Rooms well serviced.Spacious bathroom with large bath.Only problem , no shower curtain which made it difficult not to flood the floor slightly . Breakfast was good in an attractive open plan area beyond lobby. Not much in the cooked breakfast for a vegetarian like me,but plenty choice in continental. Beautiful croissants and pain au chocolat. Typically awful Italian cornflakes though.Staff were very helpful ,friendly, and accommodating. Great to get transport to and from airport across from the hotel at only 8 euros return. We were given a late check out. 3pm exceptional which really let us enjoy our last day.Thanks. Took a day trip to Assisi from Termini station across the street Wonderful.Hated the distance to walk and climb stairs to reach Line A metro. Underground not like Paris.Really limited stops and crowded and hot. Next time. I would try to use the bus more as our frequent visits to The Vatican were arduous at times.We ate in some good restaurants but a real find when we were exhausted was the food court in Termini Station. freshly made food of nice quality and very reasonably priced.To take away also. We ate there twice. Loved it. It is an area near the station but not rough like some cities. We never felt threatened or unsafe. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,great location”
Reviews.Author: strumph
Reviews.Content: Even though you are in Rome for business or for leisure I suggest you to choose this hotel for its great location. There are few steps to Termini station, in front of the hotel is the bus stop for Fiumicino and Ciampino airports, Castel Romano outlet shopping centre and red cars tour of Rome. For walking lovers, it is easily to go to Piata Venetia,Via Veneto,Piata di Spania,Fontana di Trevi,Via Corso,Piata Populi. The hotel is fully renovated (We’ve been there 4 years ago) and very clean. The rooms are spacious and what we found very interesting: you can colour you room in white/blue/red or green, as you like.Mini bar has different items and daily refilled. Many TV channels. Daily clean up services. Breakfast is generally ok but for 6 days staying it was a little boring having the same menu day by day. The front desk personnel is very kind and helpful, they do everything to please you. I suggest you to ask them for reservation to different trips, shows, outlet centres as they know better what to recommend you. We definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel close to Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: rarr1971
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean, the staff are very helpful. We don't had any kind of issues with the room, air conditioner or other stuff. The breakfast is free and have fresh fruits like pineapples, peaches and kiwis. Also have egg scrambles or hard boiled eggs in addition of breads, croisands, juices and coffee. The breakfast outside the hotele can cost you a lot, for just a coffee and croisands. The hotel is very close to Termini Station about 1 and Half minute walking. The area is 100% safe until past midnight when erevything is almost close. Tips about Rome- Avoid traffic, Buy tickets to the Colosseum in The entrace of Foro Romano. With this ticket you have access to The coloseum, Foro Romano and 3 other places with just one ticket. Drink water A LOT. Try the Fountains waters is in everywhere in Rome and taste good and FREE. Warning... If you don't loke ultra high modern furniture desing, so this hotel is not for you. For me is was the best

Reviews.Title: “contemporary hotel, great location, fair price”
Reviews.Author: nucleeus
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome and honestly we were confused by the numerous hotels available online with fancy photos etc. We chose Royal Santina for the following reasons: 1. The hotel management had actively responded to negative feedback on Trip Advisor 2. The location was central 3. The price was right for us Location: The hotel is right next to Rome's Main train station (Termini) as a result if you want to use public transport (bus, train/metro), it makes a great location. Besides, a few tourist destinations are close by (Piazza del Republica, Santa Maria Agnelli). As a result we didn't have any issues getting around. Service: We checked in late (around 10pm), the manager on duty (Mr. Claudio) was expecting us and had memorized my name. Rooms: The room was very comfortable with contemporary interiors. I especially liked that you could customize the lighting in your room (choose red, blue, green or white color themes). Breakfast: The breakfast menu was not very elaborate, but good quality . The dishes were replenished periodically and the fruits especially were fresh. I would have liked a wider variety of Italian cakes and breads. Overall, a good experience and I would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern 4 stars hotel with great value”
Reviews.Author: woanroulee
Reviews.Content: It's not the closest one to the Termini but it's definitely not too far , just pass the bus station and then make a right turn , you will find it with a pretty obvious board. The manager on the reception was very polite and helpful , he gave us great recommendations and tips for sightseeing in Rome. Everyday we ended up came back to our hotel with half broken legs, it was just too many vacation spots out there . The breakfast buffet was really good , we were given a wide variety of choices to eat . Srambled/poached egg , different kind of bacons and cheeze , machine coffee and juice , pickled fruits , cereal , crossaint and bread , lots to eat and eat all you can. we have a bathtub in the bathroom which is spacious , modern and clean. We stayed there for 2 nights and everynight i fully used the bathtub by soaking in for an hour to ease the pain of my tired legs....i have sound sleep for both night.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelingLibrary
Reviews.Content: Hotel is undergoing renovation. Rooms are being upgraded to the new European style of lots of glass, white furniture & no drawers (but a huge closet). Style is a bit "cold" but bed was very comfortable, room good size, and location excellent. Hotel is about 1 block from the Termini. Busses for the airport shuttle (less expensive than train, though longer, and easier to lift luggage) and the hop-on-hop-off bus are directly across the street. Can't get any more convenient than that! Also easy walking distance to major tourist sites. Breakfast was standard. Only complaint is that coffee comes from a machine so milk isn't fresh. Instead use the milk intended for the cereal in your coffee. For homemade and good food just around the corner is Trattoria dell' Omo. Restaurant is family owned and run. There is no sign. Look for the menu posted on the door. Try the spinach and cheese ravioli and splurge on the parma ham & cheese appetizer. Restaurant is next door to a very reasonably priced internet cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, good location, but NOT a 4 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KrisztaV77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, we stayed here for 3 nights with extended family (mother-in-law, etc.). Our flight was late at night so we worried a bit when our taxi was arrived to the hotel. It was totally wrapped, as heavy construction work carried on there - first we thought that our driver missed the address! Inside our room was modern and clean, but it was a joke outside the room... Well, it was like being on a construction area. Anyway, staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was a bit boring, totally the same every morning, scrambled eggs were cold, no fresh fruits at all... So, the hotel was really close to everything, rooms were nice and clean, price was OK - but I think it is just 3 stars...

Reviews.Title: “good location nice room and fab breakfast”
Reviews.Author: susiepnewzealand
Reviews.Content: if you want to be close to station this is perfect room was quiet and modern althuogh not all rooms done up and there is constuctin going on but it never bothered us .staff were very helpful and the breakfast was lovely. we would stay there again and we are used to nice accomodation price was reasonable for rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean rooms, but that's it !!!!”
Reviews.Author: laterstarter
Reviews.Content: We got the rooms cheap on wotif and we could see why after we got there. At first we could not find the hotel because it was in the middle of renovations and covered in plastic. Counter staff would answer your questions but that was it. If all you are looking for is a bed in a clean room and you don't care about much else, including the standard of your meals, then the hotel will suit. Breakfast is very ordinary and like others I went down the street to a great cafe opposite the station for my coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Knighton_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights. The hotel is covered in scaffolding and sheeting so impossible to see out of the windows to even check on the weather. The bathrooms are in very poor condition, dirty grouting, no enamel on the bath and horrible dirty taps and plugs. The hotel is located very near to the staion but also next to the coaches and tour buses. The double glazing is totally inadequate so the room was noisy for the majority of the night. We got very little sleep. We abandoned the idea of breakfast on the second day as it was not worth the bother.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was fine, but breakfast got old fast”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_OzAustralia
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location being right beside the train station. The staff was helpful when asked questions. The room while old was fine and surprising very little noise (highest floor) came through the patio even though we were on the street side. The hotel was doing some remodelling however this didn't have a negative effect on us. the worst part of the stay was the free breakfast. The breakfast was fine the first and even second day however after 6 days straight of the exactly same food I was ready to go on a diet. Even though the hotel says they have wireless internet they don't have any.

Reviews.Title: “Building works in progress”
Reviews.Author: CountessBath
Reviews.Content: Bulding works right outside our window. They didn't warn us and when I complained that they started at 6.50am I was told that I was mistaken as they didn't start until 9am. Next day, same start at 6.50am. 2 staff came to room and agreed it was noisy. Reception head told me I was lying and that the builders didn't start work until 8am. She only chsanged her mind when I showed her time stamped photographic proof but no apology and nothing was done to stop/lessen the noise. Room itself was OK but bathrooms have seen better days. I would not stay here again under any circumstances due purely to staff rudeness.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't call it a 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grayth
Reviews.Content: I thought I'd write a review on the Royal Santina as my girlfriend and I were moved there for a night as the hotel we had booked in at (Hotel Milani) was not ready for us. The room was very spacious and comfortable, on the face of it 4-star standard with a good bathroom. However the skirting board was caked with a carpet of dust and clearly hadn't been cleaned in months. The bed and other surfaces were perfectly clean though. The coffee machine also wasn't working, which was a disappointment, but you don't exactly struggle to find a decent cup of coffee in Rome, so it wasn't a big deal. Staff were not friendly at all and one member of staff, a smallish, bald man (who I think may have been the manager, but I'm not sure) was unhelpful when I left a shirt in the room. I went back later on in the day when we had moved to Milani and asked if a shirt had been found. I'm sure it was just a case of someone checking the room or the lost property and I was quite willing to go to the seventh floor and check the room myself if necessary, as it was my own fault. He was full of excuses and it definitely appeared that he just couldn't be bothered. We went back the next day and there were no problems. In the morning, I was woken up at about 6am by construction work on the seventh floor of another building and this went on until about 9am when we left our room. I don't know if staff at the Milani were aware of this work going on when we were given a seventh floor room, but we got a decent night's sleep overall. The Royal Santina was adequate for one night while Hotel Milani was unavailable. However, I would certainly look elsewhere for a four-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. 3 star not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: petelesbenbow
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel with a group of friends over the Wales V Italy Rugby weekend. The hotel is advertised as a 4* but is more like a 3* the rooms are a bit basic with good toiletries and clean towels every day. The breakfast was adequet with croissants meats and Cheeses together with scrambled eggsand suspect Bacon and sausages. There is major refurbishment going on on the 7th floor. This didnt effect me but some of our party stayed on the 6th floor and were woken by the workmen starting at 7am in the rooms above. The hotel is in a good location literally 100meters from the rear of the main termini station. Go out of the station turnleft and it is on your right. There are plenty of bars and restaurants in the area and the sightseeing Roma hop on, hop off tourist bus stops right outside the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Not as Advertised and Not 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: mckenna851
Reviews.Content: Ideal location immediately beside Termini Station however the hotel was not as advertised on the website. It claims to be 4 star however is more likened to a 2 star. "American Buffet Breakfast" consisted of the usual continental style offerings plus scrambled egg (lukewarm) and bacon (undercooked). I ate in the hotel restaurant (or actually the bar as the restaurant was closed) and the food was awful - main course was stone cold which I returned. Reception staff were brusque - I waited 4 minutes for my room key while the member of staff made a personal call on his mobile. The first room I was given was pretty dismal however I managed to change rooms due to the next door room on the second floor being under construction hence filling the corridor and my room with dust. I stayed in the sister hotel on my last visit which was of a higher standard. Please don't stay here unless you are doing so only for the location.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: christileah
Reviews.Content: We actually had a great stay at this hotel compared to some other reviews. We liked our room, the bed was comfortable, the tub/shower was large, we were at the back and there was no city noise at all. We enjoyed the breakfast, one of the biggest and best of the continental breakfasts that we had on our stay throughout different cities in Italy. The front desk staff wasn't the most friendly or most helpful, but no one in Italy seemed to be overly friendly. The location was great too. It was easy to hop on city transit and make your way anywhere throughout the city. There were also good places to eat nearby. Overall we really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A good base for an active city break”
Reviews.Author: wooboo22
Reviews.Content: We felt the deal we got at the Royal Santina was worthwile compared with (atleast the presentation of ) other hotels in the same street. The Royal Santinas location is right near the back entrance to the termini station (where you can get buses/metro to anywhere) however there were no decent restaurants near the hotel. Staff we're as straight faced as the majority of Romans we encountered but were pleasant and helpful. The rooms were cleaned everyday but the halls smelt faintly of cigarettes and there were a few burns/holes in some of the sheets. The bed was uncomfortable but we may have just been unlucky. We enjoyed the bar and seriously recommend the "pasta and bacon" dish the hotel serve. As a young couple the hotel offered us everything we expected and provided a good base when we had been out pounding the streets of Rome all day and needed to rest. All in all, a good hotel experience!

Reviews.Title: “No Sleep at Royal Santina”
Reviews.Author: JMCUpstateNY
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Royal Santini/Santana in Rome and did not have a very good experience. We stayed in a 'triple' at least that's what we called it. I believe it was their double with a cot. The beds were terrible, actually had a spring poking through one. The cot was even worse. Between the three of us, we were lucky to get 5 hours sleep total! Luckily our travel plans only had us staying there one night, one night too many!! It looked like this was once a nice hotel but it was evident maintenance has not been performed. If in doubt, just take a look at the lobby furniture, we didn't even dare sit on it given its shabby appearance. The reason we picked this hotel was for its location close to Termini, the rail station since we had an early train to catch to the airport. You'd be better served to find something a little farther from the station and walk ten minutes rather than five. To that, we were surprised how close distances turned out to be as compared to how far we thought they'd be from looking at maps of Rome. Avoid this place, there's much better to be had. No advantages to staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: Maximus80
Reviews.Content: Don't stay on this hotel! The furniture and the rooms are old, there is a smell of smoke everywhere in the hotel, no matter how much time you leave the windows open. The chief of the restaurant kicks you off it if you arrive near to 10h30m (on a decent hotel, you enter the restaurant and finish the breakfast without being bothered if you arrive before it closes). The location is nice. However, there is a hundred hotels near the Termini Station in Rome. You can make a better deal staying somewhere else paying probably even less than you would pay for this trash place.

Reviews.Title: “Practical location, but....”
Reviews.Author: martinDY
Reviews.Content: Stayed there many times with my company. Very practical location to be sure, and the comments about the front desk staff are very much to the point, except for a couple of the front desk staff. The review which mentioned a lost purse/bag caught my interest because two years ago, I mailed work-related materials to the hotel two months ahead of time so they'd be there when I got there; spent two weeks there and never found my stuff. I was back there SEVEN MONTHS later, and asked if by any chance my parcel had ever been received- without even looking the front desl clerk said NO!- I waited till he was busy and looked in the storage room right next to the front desk, and right there on the shelf, in PLAIN VIEW was my parcel. It had actually been there even before my FIRST visit, but no one had ever bothered to check. The food is pretty basic, but the new ddining room manager is very efficient and very pleasant. watch out for gypsies & pickpockets hanging around the front doors!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for our short break”
Reviews.Author: Glenn16
Reviews.Content: went for a short 3 night break to see the sites of Rome and could not have wished for a better hotel, friendly, helpful and ideally situated. Being next to the Termini and bus station thought there might have been a bit of noise, but all was quiet. Would certainly recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Good - but!”
Reviews.Author: LoveRome
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good base for sightseeing. It is directly opposite where the terravision airport shuttle coach drops off so there is no need to look for a taxi or walk in an unknown place although the termini (station) is literally less than 100 yds down the street and from there you can take a train, take the metro or take a bus - you will pass the real taxi rank on the way - so DO NOT get in a taxi that is waiting by the bus. The reception is smart and welcoming, the reception staff all spoke a little English - some more than others. The room was clean, warm and the beds were comfy. Not luxury but adequate. Because of the location, there is constantly the buzz of traffic and sometimes it was very loud, but I did not find this a problem as I live in a City anyway. The resturant - which was the reason I booked this hotel was sadly a disappointment. It was expensive, had a limited menu and was very unwelcoming, the hotel obviously caters for businessmen/women and tourists are classed as a nuisance by the staff and the businessmen/women alike. No smiles for us! If you are unfortunate enough to have your purse stolen while sightseeing - do not expect the staff to be sympathetic. In fact in my case one of them found if funny enough to smile at. All I asked for was directions to the nearest police station so I could report the incident for my insurance, I did not expect anyone to find this funny! I have stayed in many hotels and this one from a tourist point of view in my opion would be a 2+, most definately not 4*.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Travelpony
Reviews.Content: Biggest plus is convenience. Right next to Termini station - great for the bus from and to the airport, the metro lines both go to the Termini and everyone knows where it is so you can't get lost. Room was small but clean and comfy bed, shower was great and breakfast was fine. Will stay here again next time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “I would recomment this place!”
Reviews.Author: Christiek
Reviews.Content: I liked this place but didn't stay here long (one night), on the advice of the Venice accomodation office. It was comfortable, clean and cool (GREAT AC). Not too noisy (Higher the quieter). Decent breakfast if you like croissants.

Reviews.Title: “not so 4star”
Reviews.Author: greekfan02
Reviews.Content: does not live up to a 4star by any means, our room was small and shabby, bathroom old and mouldy tiles, shower terrible, we moved after we complained, next room a bit better well shower at least. breakfast basic and even dining room looking shabby. would not recommend you are paying for location, central but you get all the noise.

Reviews.Title: “curates egg”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very central and handy for many forms of public transport. If you fly into Ciampino airport you can get a Terravision coach which costs about 8 euros. This coach drops you off right across the road from the hotel. It can be booked online. I agree with the comments regarding the hotel reception up to a point, however, their are one or two staff who are friendly and helpful. My wife and I have just returned today 10.06.06 from our stay at The Royal Santina. Our main complaints were the lack of space. We were in a double room on the 7th floor, we had to leave our suitecases in a small narrow passage way the whole week. The wardrobe storage space was more like that of single room than a double. The room was adequate to use as a base. Be careful with the literature the hotel leaves in the room as it can be misleading with regards to what is free and what is later charged for on departure. The food provided at breakfast is just about adequate. If you like a hot breakfast you may be disappointed as the so called scrambled egg is often more like soup, the bacon when available is acceptable. the sausage in my experience is usually under cooked in the middle. My wife and I feel that a more accurate rating for this hotel is three star.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, except . . .”
Reviews.Author: Harryseaside1946
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a group at the Royal Santina and this is a consensus of their opinions. Rooms at the front noisy due to the Airport Coaches arriving and departing at all hours. Ambulance and Police sirens don't help either. Rooms at the back better but only on the higher floors as the air conditioning pipes are around the 2nd floor. 6th floor has coffee making machine but not lower floors. Rooms clean and all linen changed every day (choice of 5 kinds of pillows on offer). Housekeeping and porterage staff excellent. Reception staff really could do with lessons in hospitality - not a greeting or smile between them all week (except for the man with a bad leg - apologies to him for not remembering his name). My wife lost a gift bag in Reception and received absolutely no help whatsoever from 3 reception staff who claimed that there was no Lost Property Room and just checked Reception area. However, 3 days later my wife found the bag on top of the cleaners' trolley. The cleaner explained the policy that anything found was put in Lost Property Room!!! for one day then placed on travelling trolley until claimed. A lot of upset caused by lazy Reception staff who, it appeared, only dealt with problems behind their desk. Breakfast staff left a lot to be desired, too. One of our party had to ask 3 times for coffee machine to be replenished. The rest of us had to contend with some stale bread; no bread; lack of choice of bread; meats and cheese not topped up; tables not cleared nor places reset. A pleasant surprise was the presence of scrambled eggs, bacon and sausage albeit lukewarm because guests insisted on leaving lids up. Rome City Council ought to be ashamed of themselves in not keeping clean the Termini, the main artery Rail, Metro, bus and tourbus station. Bins overflowed at all times of the day. Homeless and drunks throughout the day were even more scary at night. Keep to main streets at night even if it takes a bit longer. The 110 Red Bus is a good system in that you buy a ticket for a day and get on and off anytime you want but be prepared to push and shove. DO NOT take the tour which includes Castlegandolfo and Frascati wine tasting. There is a stop on the tour at a lakeside cafe and this is the only point from which to see Castlegandolfo, the Pope's summer residence. Take your long distance photos at this point as it is the last time you will see it again! You then drive thru the TOWN of Castlegandolfo to Frascati where you will be made to walk up a steep hill to a bar for a glass of Frascati wine and that's it - no tasting, no chance to buy. 39 Euros a head!!!!!!!! Rome itself a delight and not to be missed but take the advice of a previous reviewer and take stout walking boots as the famous cobbles take their toll on your feet. Take in the cinematic 3-D exerience of 2 thousand years of Rome in one hour and be prepard for surprises! Look out for differing coupon leaflets - ours was 9.90 Euros plus free tour book. Trevi by night brilliant. Spanish Steps better by day than night. Don't miss, like some do, the 500-y-o sundial in the Church of Our Lady of the Angels - at one time all the clocks in Rome were set by it. If you want to see a specific site or area then get a taxi as nowhere is that far except sometimes the drivers don't know the way!!!!??? Use State controlled taxis and avoid private hire (sharks). Otherwise the 40 Express to the Vatican a cheap and cheerful trip but be sure to stamp your ticket as there is an instant fine whether you have a ticket or not! When we were there the ticket machine beside the CasteldeAngelo was broken all week so we took a chance and had a thrill ride home! Public Transport timetables are available at the Termini for the confident. If taking in the Papal Mass and Blessing - no Tour needed (40 Express) - make sure you take hat and water as you are a long time in the sun. You can also refill bottles at running water fountains nearby, not fountains with reused water. Lunchtime in Rome is just that - lunch. If you just want a beer then some places serve you inside and reserve outside tables for lunchtime trade. So ask first to avoid the embarrassment of being moved on - like us!!! All food tastes are catered for including McDonald's. You pays your money and you takes your choice! Don't forget the inevitable bowl of bread which is charged for whether you eat it or not! Just ask them to take it away to avoid this. All the other sites are well documented but be prepared to queue. The Vatican queue is extremely daunting but you can be inside in half an hour! All in all, an unforgettable experience. I wish you safe journeys and happy holiday. Harry McIlmurray

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably good hotel, but poor location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Sat 1st April 2006 The hotel was fine – room was clean and quiet, had a bath (which is not the usual in Rome!), and although the room was at the back of the hotel and reasonably small there was enough room for us. Check in was available 24 hours a day – very good for us as we had a late flight. Breakfast starts from 6.30 in the morning, and it was a cold buffet which is typical for most hotels in Rome. I would class it more as a business type hotel, as it was standard and functional rather then luxury, and there seemed to be quite a few business people staying there. Location wise, it was very close to the train station, which although is very handy for both the metro and trains across Italy, it is not a very nice location, especially at night. It is not an area I would be keen to be walking about after dark, even with my husband. Overall the hotel was pleasant enough, and it is in a handy location to Termini for our train the next morning. However, if I was staying more than one night in Rome as a tourist I would look at a hotel in a better location - such as Spanish Steps, or Piazza del Popolo, etc. They will be more expensive, but worth it for the better location.

Reviews.Title: “Who put the Royal in Royal Santina ??”
Reviews.Author: Kathie58
Reviews.Content: I escorted a group of women to Italy in May, spending 3 nights at the Royal Santina in Rome. We found the front desk staff indifferent. Some times we were ignored...other times they were a bit testy. Everything was an effort. My advice...if you don't like your job, look elsewhere. Rooms do not have safes so, I used the hotel safe for passports, documents etc. Hated to have to retrieve anything as I knew I would face another scowl at the desk. Our group evening meal at the hotel was pasta and fish. We specifically requested no fish but we got fish. Italian food is wonderful, the food we were served should not be allowed in Italy or on the continent for that matter. If you decide to stay here, eat elsewhere! The breakfast buffet was just average...nothing to get excited about. AND the only coffee available was out of a small machine where guests lined up in the morning. We ended up walking the block to Termi Station and buying coffee and fresh pastries there. When escorting a group, I have to do my best not to let the others know of my dissatisfaction. If a member complains, I try to resolve the problem and sell the positive side....and the only positive to this hotel is that the location was fairly good for getting around by foot or tranportation. The hotel carpeting is dirty. Rooms in the back of the hotel were quiet but smaller than rooms in the front which were noisy due to constant traffic. Also, due to the proximity to the rail station, problems can arise. Two very seedy characters spent a few hours in the hotel lobby one afternoon. They were disrupted and unsettling...but never asked to leave. They later left on their own and when exiting the hotel walked right into our group almost knocking down 2 of the women. This happened right in front of the desk but not one of the 3 men behind the desk said a word. I travel a great deal and don't need lavish furnishings but I do like a clean room and a welcoming face. Rooms and attitudes need refurbishing. This hotel is lucky to get 2 stars. The hotel is definitely used primarily for groups. I would not stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Dont prebook your evening meals”
Reviews.Author: Paul063
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights - 2 of which we had paid for evening meal. We were not offered the menu even though we had paid more than the set menu price. Instead we were given no choice and served with what I presume was whatever was left. Staff were unhelpful with nobody willing to take responsibilty. Complaint to hotel has unsurprisingly been unanswered.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place”
Reviews.Author: suzeeqwb
Reviews.Content: The room was sufficient for a couple. The air conditioning was not adequate for the heat of the day--in fact, it seemed it was turned off during the evening hours even though the fan remained on. The staff was fine, but a few were a bit testy when you tried to speak Italian and didn't quite say it correctly. The area was a little seedy by the termini. A great bakery was just a block over and it was easy to walk to a few Piazzas in the evening. The food at the hotel was good. But rushed through the courses.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel.Situated on a street facing the side entrance to Rome's Termini train station the hotel is perfect for people who want to be able to walk from the station to their hotel,without having to queue for taxis.To be honest I have nothing negative to say about this hotel, the rooms were large by Rome standards and very clean and modern.The lobby area is spacious and the english speaking staff were helpful and professional, I would disagree with comments made about poor staff manner on a previous review of this hotel.Excellent value for money and would strongly recommend this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Premier Hotel Royal Santina
HotelInfo.Address: Via Marsala 22, 00185 Rome, Italy
